summary: About 46,000 Transportation Security Officers closely interact with passengers when they screen them at U.S. airports. To respond to COVID-19 , the Transportation Security Administration took steps such as granting officers additional paid leave, and requiring them to use surgical masks and face shields and to physically distance from coworkers and passengers. TSA also changed how some screening technologies are used and is testing new...
title: COVID-19: TSA Could Better Monitor Its Efforts to Reduce Infectious Disease Spread at Checkpoints
